pages.about_description: Learn about the social objective, technologies and APIs used in the Faro Guide

about.hero_description: Learn about the social objective, technologies used and information about the development of the Faro Guide.
about.objective_p1: The Faro Guide is a public utility project developed with the aim of democratizing access to information about the city of Faro. Created independently and non-profit, this digital guide offers essential information for residents and visitors completely free of charge.
about.objective_p2: The main mission is to facilitate the daily life of those who live or visit Faro, bringing together in one place information about:
about.objective_p3: The project pays special attention to accessibility, including support for assistive technologies, dark mode and content available in Portuguese and English.
about.tech_description: The Faro Guide is developed with modern web technologies, prioritizing performance, accessibility and ease of maintenance:
about.tech_features: The project is 100% frontend, without the need for a backend server, which ensures faster loading and facilitates hosting and maintenance. It includes features such as:
about.tech_features_1: Progressive Web App (PWA) with offline support
about.apis_description: The project integrates data from multiple public and open sources to provide accurate and up-to-date information:
about.api_geo_desc: Portuguese API for geographic and demographic data of Portuguese municipalities.
about.api_cmf_desc: Official information about municipal services, transport and public facilities.
about.api_portal_desc: Data on health services, pharmacies and other public services.
about.api_turismo_desc: Official tourist information, events and points of interest.
about.api_osm_desc: Open collaborative maps used for geographic visualization.
about.api_proximo_desc: Public transport data and real-time schedules.
about.license_description: This project is open source and available under a free license for public use.
about.license_box_p1: âœ“ The content of this site can be freely consulted by anyone
about.license_box_p2: âœ“ The source code is available for consultation and contributions
about.license_box_p3: âœ“ The information is provided for educational and informational purposes
about.license_box_p4: âœ“ All data from external APIs is subject to the licenses of the respective sources
about.author_description: The Faro Guide is developed and maintained independently as a personal public utility project. The development is done voluntarily, non-profit, with the aim of contributing to the local community.
about.author_support: If this project is useful to you, consider supporting it voluntarily through the "Support the Project" button at the bottom of the page. The site will always remain 100% free and without advertising.
about.contact_description: For suggestions, corrections or questions about the project:

health.hero_description: Information about hospitals, health centers, pharmacies and emergency contacts in Faro.
health.quick_access_link: ğŸš¨ Need Help Now? Quick Access
health.pharmacies_info: There are several pharmacies in Faro, with a 24-hour rotation service.
health.pharmacies_on_duty_info: Pharmacies on duty: to check the nearest on-duty pharmacy call Linha SaÃºde 24: 808 24 24 24 or visit www.portaldasfarmacias.pt
health.note_emergency: Important note: In case of a serious medical emergency, always call 112.

transport.hero_description: Complete guide on night mobility in Faro. Find information about last buses, taxis, TVDE and safe routes to move around the city at night.
transport.important_warning_text: Schedules may vary on weekends and public holidays. Please verify up-to-date schedules on the operator website or mobile app.
transport.avoid_zones_title: âš ï¸ Areas to Avoid at Night

environment.hero_description: Information about sustainability, recycling and environmental care in Faro. Together we can make a difference for our city and the planet.
environment.what_to_recycle_intro: Learn about the different types of recycling containers (ecopoints) and what to dispose in each.
environment.ecopoints_description: Main locations of recycling containers (ecopoints) around the city of Faro:
environment.recolha_intro: Free bulky waste collection service (furniture, mattresses, large appliances, etc.)
environment.recolha_details: Bulky waste collection must be scheduled in advance with municipal services. Do not leave bulky items in public spaces without a booking.
environment.attention_text: Hazardous waste, construction debris and tyres should be delivered to the Ecocentre.
environment.ecocentro_intro: Collection centre for waste that cannot be deposited in regular recycling points.
environment.ecocentro_location: Zona Industrial de Faro, SÃ­tio das Barradas
environment.ecocentro_accepts_label: â™»ï¸ What you can deposit at the Ecocentre:
environment.ecocentro_access: Free for residents (must present ID and proof of residence in Faro)
environment.tips_intro: Small actions that make a difference for a more sustainable Faro:
environment.tip_save_water_desc: Turn off the tap while brushing your teeth and prefer quick showers. An open tap wastes about 12 litres of water per minute.
environment.tip_save_energy_desc: Turn off devices on standby and prefer LED bulbs. They can reduce energy consumption by up to 80%.
environment.tip_use_reusable_desc: Always carry a reusable bag when shopping. A plastic bag takes hundreds of years to decompose.
environment.tip_sustainable_mobility_desc: Choose to walk, cycle or use public transport whenever possible. It reduces pollution and is good for health.
environment.tip_avoid_food_waste_desc: Plan meals, use leftovers and compost. In Portugal, about 1 million tonnes of food are wasted each year.
environment.tip_recycle_correctly_desc: Rinse containers before recycling and separate materials correctly. Recycling saves natural resources and energy.
environment.tip_care_greens_desc: Respect parks and gardens, don't litter and help keep Faro clean and green.
environment.tip_protect_ria_desc: The Ria Formosa is a natural treasure. Do not leave rubbish on beaches and respect local fauna and flora.

activities.hero_title: What to do today in Faro
activities.simulator_description: Use the simulator below to find activities in Faro that match your interests and schedule.

leisure.hero_description: Discover the best of Faro: beaches, museums, green spaces and cultural events. Explore the city's natural and cultural heritage.
leisure.beaches_intro: Faro is the gateway to some of the Algarve's most beautiful beaches, located in the stunning Ria Formosa, a protected natural park.
leisure.islands_access_desc: Boats depart regularly from the Porta Nova pier (near the historic centre) and Faro Marina to the islands of the Ria Formosa.
leisure.islands_hours: Variable depending on season (more frequent in summer)
leisure.islands_prices: Between â‚¬3 and â‚¬15 (round trip, depending on destination)
leisure.museums_intro: Faro has a rich historical and cultural heritage, with museums that tell the region's story from Roman times to the present day.
leisure.museums_tip: ğŸ’¡ Tip: Many museums offer free entry or discounts on specific days. Check seasonal opening hours, which may vary between summer and winter.
leisure.parks_intro: Faro offers several green spaces perfect for relaxing, exercising or simply enjoying nature.
leisure.parks_birdwatch: ğŸ¦ Birdwatching: The Ria Formosa is one of the best birdwatching spots in Europe, especially during migrations. Over 200 species have been recorded in the area.
leisure.events_intro: Faro has a rich cultural calendar, with traditional events, music festivals, gastronomy and religious celebrations throughout the year.
leisure.events_agenda: ğŸ“± Cultural Agenda: Check the full cultural agenda on the Faro City Council website or at the tourist office for exact dates and detailed programming.

restaurants.hero_description: Discover the best cafes, bakeries and restaurants in Faro. Search, filter and find the perfect place to eat or have a coffee in the Algarve capital.

hotels.hero_description: Find the perfect accommodation in Faro. Hotels, hostels, apartments and local stays for all tastes and budgets.

living.description: Essential guide for those who recently moved to Faro. Practical information about documents, transport, health, costs and city areas.
living.documents_intro: When moving to Faro, it's important to update your documents and registrations. Here are the essential steps:
living.financas_desc: You can update it online at www.portaldasfinancas.gov.pt
living.presencial_desc: Faro Tax Office, Rua Dr. JosÃ© de Matos, 8000-503 Faro
living.docs_needed_desc: Citizen Card or ID, proof of address (rental contract or utility bill)
living.health_center_intro: To access public health services, you should register at a health center:
living.health_local_desc: Centro de SaÃºde de Faro, Rua LeÃ£o Penedo, 8000-355 Faro
living.health_docs_desc: Citizen Card, SNS User Card (if you have one), proof of address
living.health_tip_desc: You can book online via the SNS portal
living.driving_license_intro: If you come from another EU country, you can use your driving license. For non-EU countries:
living.imt_desc: IMT - Instituto da Mobilidade e dos Transportes, EN125, 8000-126 Faro
living.municipal_services_intro: For issues related to the municipality (waste, water, municipal taxes):
living.documents_tip: ğŸ’¡ Important tip: Always bring copies of important documents and an updated proof of address.
living.transport_intro: Faro offers several public transport options and alternatives for travel within and outside the city.
living.transport_tip: ğŸ’¡ Mobility Tip: For more information about transport, check the dedicated Transport page.
living.health_section_intro: Faro has public and private health services to meet residents' needs.
living.health_tip: ğŸ’¡ For more details: Check the full Health page with addresses and a services map.
living.cost_intro: Faro offers a relatively affordable cost of living compared to other district capitals in Portugal, especially Lisbon and Porto.
living.cost_estimate: ğŸ’¡ Total Estimate: A single adult can live comfortably in Faro with â‚¬900-1200/month (including rent). A couple may need â‚¬1500-2000/month.
living.cost_note: Note: These values are estimates based on 2024 data and may vary. Housing prices have increased in recent years due to tourist demand.
living.zones_intro: Faro is divided into several areas, each with its own characteristics. Learn about the main neighborhoods:
living.zones_tip: ğŸ’¡ Choice Tip: Visit different areas before deciding where to live. Consider proximity to work, transport and services that matter to you.

history.hero_description: Discover the rich history of Faro through the centuries, from its foundation to the present day.
history.about_p1: Faro is one of the oldest cities in Portugal, with a history dating back more than two thousand years. Located in the south of the country, in the Algarve region, Faro has been an important commercial and cultural center since Roman times.
history.about_p2: The city was the scene of several significant historical events, from Roman and Moorish occupation to reconstruction after the 1755 earthquake. Today, Faro is the administrative capital of the Algarve and an important tourist destination, preserving its rich historical and cultural heritage.
history.timeline_desc_phoenician: Archaeological evidence indicates that the territory of Faro has been inhabited since the Neolithic period. The Phoenicians established a trading post here, taking advantage of the strategic location next to the Ria Formosa.
history.timeline_desc_roman: During Roman rule, Faro was known as Ossonoba and became an important administrative and commercial center of Lusitania. The city developed significantly with the construction of temples, forums and urban infrastructure.
history.timeline_desc_visigoth: With the fall of the Roman Empire, Ossonoba came under Visigothic rule. The city became an episcopal see, consolidating its religious importance in the region.
history.timeline_desc_moorish: During more than 500 years of Muslim occupation, the city was renamed HÃ¡rune (Santa Maria). This period marked significant development in terms of agriculture, architecture and culture. The walls and urban layout of the historic center date from this time.
history.timeline_desc_reconquest: Faro was the last Algarve city to be reconquered by Christians. King Afonso III took the city, completing the Reconquest of the Algarve. This event marked the end of Muslim rule in the Iberian Peninsula.
history.timeline_desc_discoveries: During the Age of Discoveries, Faro prospered as an important port in maritime trade. The city benefited from the economic and cultural development of this golden period in Portuguese history.
history.timeline_desc_essex: The city was sacked and burned by the Earl of Essex during an English attack. The Bishop of Faro's library was taken to England, where it now forms the founding nucleus of Oxford's Bodleian Library.
history.timeline_desc_earthquake: The great earthquake of 1755 destroyed much of the city. The reconstruction that followed transformed Faro into a Pombaline city, with more rational urban planning and buildings more resistant to earthquakes.
history.timeline_desc_capital: Faro was officially designated capital of the Kingdom of the Algarve, replacing Lagos. This change consolidated the administrative and political importance of the city in the region.
history.timeline_desc_railway: The inauguration of the railway linking Faro to the rest of the country marked the beginning of the city's modernization and facilitated the region's economic and tourist development.
history.timeline_desc_airport: The inauguration of Faro Airport significantly boosted tourism in the Algarve, making the region more accessible to international visitors and contributing to local economic development.
history.timeline_desc_university: The creation of the University of the Algarve in Faro transformed the city into an important center of teaching and research, attracting students and academics from all over the country and abroad.
history.timeline_desc_modern: Today, Faro is a modern city that combines its rich historical heritage with contemporary infrastructure. It is the administrative capital of the Algarve, an important tourist destination and a vibrant cultural center.
history.evolution_description: The urban evolution of Faro reflects the different eras and cultural influences that have marked the city over the centuries.
history.evolution_historic_desc: The medieval core, surrounded by walls from the Islamic period, preserves the ancient urban layout. Notable features include the Cathedral, the Arco da Vila and the episcopal palaces, all rebuilt after 1755.
history.evolution_pombaline_desc: After the 1755 earthquake, the city expanded following Pombaline urban planning principles, with wide streets and an orthogonal layout. This area is characterized by neoclassical buildings and greater urban regularity.
history.evolution_waterfront_desc: The development of the Riverside Park and marina transformed the waterfront into a leisure and tourism space. The redevelopment of this area enhanced the city's relationship with the Ria Formosa.
history.evolution_modern_desc: In the 20th century, Faro expanded significantly to the north and west, with new residential neighborhoods, commercial areas and the university campus. The airport and highways improved accessibility.
history.evolution_natural_desc: The Ria Formosa, classified as a Natural Park in 1987, is a fundamental element of Faro's identity. The preservation of this unique ecosystem conditions and enriches urban development.
history.evolution_future_desc: Current development plans focus on sustainability, urban mobility, redevelopment of public spaces and promotion of Faro's cultural and historical identity.
history.footer_data_sources: Data sources: Faro City Council, Faro Municipal Museum, University of the Algarve

lazer.instalado_no_antigo_convento_de_nossa_se: Housed in the former Convent of Our Lady of the Assumption (16th century). Exhibitions of archaeology, sacred art and Algarve ethnography.
lazer.largo_dom_afonso_iii_centro_histrico: ğŸ“ Largo Dom Afonso III, Historic Centre

lazer.coleo_etnogrfica_que_mostra_o_modo_de_vi: Ethnographic collection showing traditional Algarve life: crafts, agricultural tools, typical costumes and recreated settings.
lazer.espao_interativo_dedicado_divulgao_da_c: Interactive space dedicated to science outreach, with exhibitions about the sea, astronomy and the biodiversity of the Ria Formosa.
lazer.rua_comandante_francisco_manuel_junto: ğŸ“ Rua Comandante Francisco Manuel, near Doca de Faro

lazer.capela_nica_decorada_com_ossos_e_caveira: Unique chapel decorated with bones and skulls of over 1000 monks. A 19th-century religious and artistic monument.
lazer.igreja_do_carmo_largo_do_carmo: ğŸ“ Igreja do Carmo, Largo do Carmo
lazer.catedral_gticarenascentista_do_sculo_xii: Gothic-Renaissance cathedral from the 13th century, built over a former mosque. Tower with panoramic views over Faro and the Ria Formosa.
lazer.largo_da_s_centro_histrico: ğŸ“ Largo da SÃ©, Historic Centre
lazer.jardim_histrico_junto_ao_porto_com_rvore: Historic garden next to the harbour with century-old trees and views over the Ria Formosa. A traditional meeting point for locals.
lazer.parque_moderno_junto_doca_ideal_para_ca: Modern park by the dock, ideal for walking, running and cycling. Wide green space with views of the marina and Ria Formosa.
lazer.sistema_lagunar_protegido_com_18000_hect: Protected lagoon system covering 18,000 hectares. One of Portugal's 7 Natural Wonders. Habitat for hundreds of bird species.
lazer.centro_de_educao_ambiental_quinta_de_m: ğŸ“ Environmental Education Centre - Quinta de Marim
lazer.alameda_arborizada_no_centro_da_cidade_p: Tree-lined avenue in the city centre, perfect for quiet walks. Large trees provide pleasant shade.
lazer.zona_de_luxo_com_extensos_espaos_verdes: Luxury area with extensive green spaces, golf courses and beach access. Area of great natural beauty.
lazer.quinta_do_lago_15_min_de_faro: ğŸ“ Quinta do Lago (15 min from Faro)
lazer.acesso_livre_s_reas_pblicas: â° Free access to public areas
lazer.mata_nacional_das_dunas_litorais_de_faro: National Forest of the Coastal Dunes of Faro
lazer.floresta_de_pinheiros_junto_praia_de_fa: Pine forest next to Praia de Faro. Trails for walking and cycling in a natural environment.
lazer.principal_espao_cultural_de_faro_teatro: Main cultural venue in Faro. Theatre, dance, music, cinema and exhibitions.
lazer.cinemas_no_frum_algarve_shopping_com_as: Cinemas at FÃ³rum Algarve Shopping with the latest national and international releases.
lazer.espao_moderno_com_vasto_acervo_bibliogrf: Modern space with a large bibliographic collection, reading room, internet and cultural activities.

oque_fazer_hoje.escolha_o_dia_da_semana: ğŸ“… Choose the day of the week
oque_fazer_hoje.apanhe_o_barco_no_cais_e_descubra_as_ilh: Catch a boat at the pier and discover Faro's islands. Praia de Faro, Ilha Deserta and Culatra are perfect for a sunny day.
oque_fazer_hoje.explore_o_parque_ribeirinho_de_faro_de_b: Explore the Parque Ribeirinho by bike or on foot. Stunning views over the Ria Formosa and the marina.
oque_fazer_hoje.visite_a_quinta_de_marim_no_parque_natur: Visit Quinta de Marim in the Ria Formosa Natural Park. Hiking trails and birdwatching in a unique natural environment.
oque_fazer_hoje.tours_pela_ria_formosa_com_observao_da_f: Ria Formosa tours with wildlife observation. Sunset trips are especially beautiful.
oque_fazer_hoje.passeie_pelas_ruas_calcetadas_do_centro: Stroll the cobbled streets of the historic centre, visit the Cathedral and climb Arco da Vila for panoramic views.
oque_fazer_hoje.aproveite_os_campos_de_golfe_de_classe_m: Enjoy world-class golf courses at Quinta do Lago and Vale do Lobo, near Faro.
oque_fazer_hoje.descubra_a_histria_de_faro_no_antigo_con: Discover Faro's history in the former Convent of Our Lady of the Assumption. Archaeology and sacred art collections.

transportes.os_autocarros_em_faro_tm_um_servio_limit: Buses in Faro have limited service at night. Plan ahead and check last-bus schedules to ensure you can get home.

In case of doubt or medical emergency, always contact a qualified healthcare professional or call 112. The information presented here is in the public domain and is subject to change without notice.
